unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: Height/Arm Span Relationship
question_text: ​Scientists wish to determine if there is a positive linear relationship between height and arm span. Which of the following would give us evidence of a positive relationship between these variables in a sample of $40$ random subjects?

choices.text: The correlation coefficient being close to − 1 − 1 .
The p-value in a linear regression T T -test being close to 0 0 when testing H 0 : B = 0 H 0 : B = 0 H a : B > 0 H a : B > 0
A residual plot that shows the data points haphazardly scattered.
A slope in the LSRL close to 1 1 .
A scatterplot without any influential points or outliers.
